abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders has tapped into long-held aggressive side to launch series of blunt attacks against Hillary Clinton in approach to New York Democratic presidential primary; combative approach harks back to Sanders's 1986 run for Vermont governor; while some welcome sharp-edged rhetoric as overdue, others worry it may alienate supporters who were drawn to his positive campaign.
lead_paragraph: The Democratic presidential candidate with a reputation for being issues oriented has not shied away from mixing it up personally with opponents.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders’s Campaign Past Reveals Willingness to Play Hardball
headline.print_headline: Sanders Turns to Tough Tactics in Home Stretch

snippet: The Democratic presidential candidate with a reputation for being issues oriented has not shied away from mixing it up personally with opponents....
